required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of Camrelizumab Combined With Nab-Paclitaxel Plus Gemcitabine for Metastatic Pancreatic Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase II, Single-arm Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of PD-1 Antibody Camrelizumab in Combination With Nab-paclitaxel Plus Gemcitabine in Treating Patients With Metastatic Pancreatic Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: The present study is intended to investigate the objective response rate (ORR) and the progression-free survival (PFS) of the patients with histologically- or cytologically-confirmed metastatic pancreatic cancer after treating with the combination of camrelizumab, gemcitabine and nab-paclitaxel, and to investigate the overall survival (OS) and the adverse event (AE) of the patients with histologically- or cytologically-confirmed metastatic pancreatic cancer after treating with the combination of camrelizumab, gemcitabine and nab-paclitaxel.

detailed_description.textblock: This a prospective, single-arm, open-label, phase 2 studye evaluating the efficacy and safety of camrelizumab, gemcitabine and nab-paclitaxel for metastatic pancreatic cancer patients. The primary endpoints are ORR and PFS, and the secondary are OS and adverse events.

primary_outcome.time_frame: from enrollment to time of evaluation or date of death from any cause, whichever came first, estimated 18 months
primary_outcome.description: To evaluate the Overall Response Rate of patients with metastatic pancreatic cancer after the treatment of camrelizumab with nab-paclitaxel plus gemcitabine.

primary_outcome.time_frame: from enrollment to time of evaluation or date of death from any cause, whichever came first, estimated 18 months
primary_outcome.description: To evaluate the Progression Free Survival of patients with metastatic pancreatic cancer after the treatment of camrelizumab with nab-paclitaxel plus gemcitabine.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from enrollment to time of evaluation or date of death from any cause, whichever came first, estimated 18 months
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the overall survival of patients with metastatic pancreatic cancer after the treatment of camrelizumab with nab-paclitaxel plus gemcitabine.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from enrollment to time of evaluation or date of death from any cause, whichever came first, estimated 18 months
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the adverse events of patients with metastatic pancreatic cancer after the treatment of camrelizumab with nab-paclitaxel plus gemcitabine.

arm_group.description: PD-1 Monoclonal Antibody Camrelizumab at 200 mg on Day 1 and 15 nab-paclitaxel at 100 mg/m2 on Day 1, 8, and 15; gemcitabine at 1000 mg/m2 on Day 1, 8, and 15

intervention.description: Patients firstly receive camrelizumab 200 mg per time (iv, no less than 20 minutes and no more than 60 minutes, rinse time included) on Day 1 and 15 for 3 weeks, followed by one week without treatment. Treatment repeats every 4 weeks until the disease recurrence, unacceptable toxicity, death or begin a novel therapeutic.

Patients secondly receive nab-paclitaxel 100 mg/m2 (iv, at least 30 minutes) on days 1, 8, and 15 for 3 weeks, followed by one week without treatment. Treatment repeats every 4 weeks until the disease recurrence, unacceptable toxicity, death or begin a novel therapeutic.

At last, patients receive gemcitabine 1000 mg/m2 (iv, 30 minutes) on days 1, 8, and 15 for 3 weeks, followed by one week without treatment. Treatment repeats every 4 weeks until the disease recurrence, unacceptable toxicity, death or begin a novel therapeutic.

facility.name: Department of Pancreatic and Hepatobiliary Surgery, Fudan University Shanghai Cancer Center; Pancreatic Cancer Institute, Fudan University
